entities.name: padfoot
entities.description: Padfoot is the recipient of the letter and is mentioned as someone who sent Harry a birthday present. The description mentions that Padfoot could not attend Harry's birthday due to the Order's priorities.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main subject of the letter and is described as being one year old and already showing interest in flying on a toy broomstick. The description mentions that Harry smashed a vase and nearly killed the cat while playing with his new toy.

entities.name: james
entities.description: James is mentioned as someone who finds Harry's behavior funny and thinks he will be a great Quidditch player. The description mentions that James is getting frustrated being shut up here.

entities.name: petunia
entities.description: Petunia is mentioned as the one who sent a vase to the family for Christmas, which Harry smashed.

entities.name: bathilda
entities.description: Bathilda is mentioned as someone who has always been sweet to the family and dotes on Harry.

entities.name: the order
entities.description: The Order is mentioned as a group that takes priority over attending Harry's birthday. The description mentions that the Order's priorities are why Padfoot could not attend.

relationships.description: Padfoot sent a gift to Harry for his birthday, which is described as Harry's favorite present.
James finds Harry's interest in flying on the toy broomstick funny and thinks he will be a great Quidditch player.
